results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Bendigo Education Resource Centre, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.

results.title: Beneath our feet. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.

results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.title: Early Melbourne: from village to town
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Dr Bernard Barrett, State Historian, discusses the early development of Melbourne, covering such topics as the naming of Melbourne, who decided where the streets would be located and what they would be called.

results.title: Changing Times - Changing Schools: Establishing Victorian Secondary Colleges
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Warren Thomas and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Educational administrators, teachers, parents and students comment on a range of re-organisation arrangements developed to enable Victorian secondary schools to better respond to todays workforce requirements and the needs of young adults in schooling.

results.title: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology
results.creator_credit: David Tiley, Penny Robins, Video Projects and Commonwealth Schools Commission (Australia)
results.brief_description: Looks at the use of computers as word-processors and databases in the teaching of history. Programs such as database, newsroom and open database are shown being used. The program also highlights some of the problems, and some of the advantages of using this approach to the teaching of history.

results.title: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Bob Scarfe, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: An education officer from the Museum of Victoria looks at a number of “labour saving appliances” used in the home over the last one hundred and fifty years and looks at the development of laundry and kitchen appliances.

results.title: Bicycles down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: An introduction to the history of the bicycle, looking at some of the technical and social changes in the past one hundred and twenty years. Bill Sidebottom and Doug McCann from Museum of Victoria present a collection of vintage and veteran bicycles to tell the story.

results.title: Conflict
results.creator_credit: Halina Sztynda, Melanie Guiney and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Presents the views of the Forest Commission, loggers and conservationists in regard to logging practices in East Gippsland. Allows the viewer to draw conclusions about the attitudes and prejudices of the conservationists and the loggers and saw millers.
